   Home/Politics/No, Reliance Jio has not entered agricultural sector after
   farm bills were passed

   No, Reliance Jio has not entered agricultural sector after farm bills were
                                     passed

   AvatarAvatarby Archit
     * Share
     * Tweet
     * Pin it
     * Share
     * Email
     * More

   In the backdrop of ongoing farmers’ protests against the centre’s three
   new farm bills that promote privatisation in the agricultural sector,
   multiple images of ‘Jio’ wheat have gone viral.

Jio is a sub-brand of
   Reliance Industries Limited (RIL).

(Translated from: कानून बाद में बने है और थैले पहले ये तस्वीर बहुत कुछ कह
   रही है । अब तो समझ जाओ)

   Twitter user @Shazi__786 posted one of the images and wrote, “Jio’s wheat
   has also come in the market, one day it will occupy the whole country and
   we will all become their slaves, if we are not aware then we will yearn
   for the grain.

And consumers in India can easily get away with it
   since we don’t have laws that can get one arrested for purchasing fake
   premium products (unlike France and Italy).”

   Therefore, images of a wheat brand named ‘Jio’ were shared with the false
   claim that Reliance has entered the agricultural sector and the farm bills
   were passed to benefit the company.
